intro: Hyperacanthus perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features striking yellow-orange flowers that are surrounded by colorful bracts, making it visually distinctive. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a waxy texture, adapted to its arid or semi-arid habitat. Hyperacanthus perrieri is often found in rocky or disturbed soils, thriving in environments with limited moisture.
